heading: Bump In/Out Details
content: Loading Dock Access Map

Guns N Roses is playing a concert in Accor Stadium on Sunday 27 November. Due to the size of the event Sydney Olympic Park Authority has placed a number of road closures around the precinct. These will change the route of move out for exhibitors and suppliers. The attached plan shows the changes.
*Yellow is the new route: Entry to the loading dock will now be as follows:
Turn off Australia Avenue onto Grand Parade (via Gate 11), then turn left onto Monaro Street, and right onto Riverina Parade.
This will get you to the loading dock doors which were used for move in.
*Red is the road closures
*The blue cross shows a location where U-turns are permitted.

Bump In times:
Friday 25 November 1pm-7pm
Saturday 26 November 8am-9am

Bump out time:
Sunday 27 November 6pm-8pm

A reminder that all exhibitors at the venue during Bump In/Out must be wearing safety (high visibility) vests and closed-in shoes. These are available at many stores including places such as Officeworks and Bunnings.
No persons under the age of 15 are allowed at the venue during Bump In/Out.

heading: Exponet
content: Our venue services provider this year is Exponet. They will be the ones building all the stalls and booths as well as the stage. Exponet will be given a list of exhibitor contact details so that you can order extra things for your stall/booth from them if necessary. This includes services such as extra lighting and electricity.

heading: Parking
content: The venue will be given a list of exhibitor details and they will contact you directly regarding discounted parking etc.

heading: Workshops
content: Expressions of interest for workshops have now closed. Thank you for those who volunteered. The Book Fair Australia Team is currently going through the list to make their selection.

heading: Panels
content: Expressions of interest for panels have now closed. Thank you for those who volunteered. Our Event Hosts are currently going through the list to make their selection.

heading: Stall Dimensions
content: Stall and Booth dimensions vary depending on your application.
Author Half Stalls include: a 1x2m area; Velcro compatible 2.4m high walls; sharing a 1x 6ft table with another author; 1x chair; and 1 exhibitor pass.
Author and Vendor Stalls include: a 2x2m area; Velcro compatible 2.4m high walls; 1x 6ft table; 2x chairs; and 2 exhibitor passes.

Author and Vendor Booths include: a 3x3m area; Velcro compatible 2.4m high walls as required; tables and chairs as required; and 3 exhibitor passes. If more than one Booth has been applied for, the area, number of tables, chairs and exhibitor passes increases proportionally.

heading: Program Advertising
content: All attendees at the event will be given a showbag with a program and swag, including promotional bookmarks etc. If you would like to advertise in our program or provide swag for the bags, please consider these options and get in touch with us.
Swag for bags – No charge but must provide enough for 2000 bags - due to unforeseen popularity, this option will only be available for the first 20 exhibitors who contact us about it
¼ page ad – $200
½ page ad – $300
Full page ad – $500

heading: Pre-order forms
content: As this is the first event and there is no set precedent for sales this year, the Book Fair Australia Exhibitor Team has created a pre-order form template for our authors to use. Vendors are welcome to use the pre-order forms as well if it suits their business. Please note this is an example template only. You must create your own pre-order form and send us the link.

We will email all attendees on a fortnightly basis, to tell them the latest news about the event and give them a list of all exhibitors with pre-order forms. To aid us with this, we would greatly appreciate it if you can send through your links when they’re up and running and let us know when pre-orders have closed so that they can be deleted from this list.

As we get closer to the event, we’ll start sharing the attendee numbers with you so that you can better plan for how much stock to bring with you. We currently expect a minimum of 2000 attendees over the weekend, but every time our exhibitors share news about the event, we increase our chances of bringing in more attendees and potential customers for all our exhibitors.

heading: Brand Kit
content: Our Brand kit is now available. Please follow its direction when representing Book Fair Australia in your communications and content.

heading: $5 Vouchers
content: As part of all paid tickets, attendees will receive at least one $5 voucher. These vouchers are valid at any stall or booth at the event. All exhibitors are expected to accept them. All exhibitors will be reimbursed for vouchers within 2 weeks of the event.

Attendees can only use one voucher per person per stall, so that they are encouraged to make purchases at more than one place. This will be up to you to monitor as we cannot do this ourselves. We ask you to please respect this limit to allow other exhibitors the chance to make as many sales as you.
At the end of the weekend, vouchers will be collected from each stall in a Ziplock bag with the Stall/Booth name on it.

heading: Raffle Donations
content: As part of the event, we will be running afternoon raffles each day. VIP tickets automatically have 20 tickets in their names. All other attendees will have the opportunity to purchase raffle tickets at the event.

We encourage all exhibitors to donate one item (book, bookmark etc) for this raffle when they bump in. You can donate more than one item if you wish. Volunteers will assemble the raffle prizes on the Friday afternoon/Saturday morning.
80% of the raffle profits will be donated to the World Literacy Foundation.

heading: Public Liability Insurance
content: All exhibitors are required to obtain public liability insurance for this event. All exhibitors must provide their public liability insurance certificate no later than 1 month prior to the event. For first time exhibitors, if you search for “Market Stall Insurance” on Google, you will find there are many options available. Book Fair Australia cannot recommend one over another. We suggest you obtain quotes and discuss options with the insurance companies yourself.

heading: Payment methods
content: To limit the spread of COVID-19, we encourage contactless payment methods, though you may accept cash payments if you wish. There are a number of options out there including, but not limited to, Square and PayPal. If you do not have these types of options set up already, we suggest you look into it at least a month before the event to ensure you have time to set up your accounts and verify banking details etc.

heading: Promotions and Giveaways
content: Book Fair Australia was mainly created to give authors and other creative vendors an opportunity to meet readers they would otherwise not have the chance to connect with. For this, we need your help! All exhibitors are encouraged to like and share our event through their various social medias and/or mailing lists. The more attendees we get, the more chances you’ll have to sell your books, merchandise and services to a new market.

To aid in this, Book Fair Australia has organised 2 weekend passes (admittance only) per exhibitor to give away in their own promotion/competition. This ticket will not include vouchers or any other benefits associated with paid tickets – it will be admittance for the weekend. Codes have been emailed out to each exhibitor. If you did not receive yours, please let us know.

heading: Facebook Group
content: If you have not already seen it, there is now a Facebook group specifically for Exhibitors to interact with each other and ask questions etc before the event. We welcome you to join if you have a Facebook account.

heading: Discord Server
content: We also have a Discord server. This is a place where you can interact with exhibitors, readers and attendees. All members ofthe Book Fair Australia organising committee are members of this channel.
